definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

sentences.english: Ceartainly is a worst old bad egg.
Here dwells the villain of English children's stories—the red fox.
sentences.chinese: 英國兒童讀物中出現的大壞蛋紅狐狸就住在這裏。

sentences.english: The bbg heard that God had come to his neck of the woods and went to meet with Him.
sentences.chinese: 那個大壞蛋聽說到神已來到他那塊就去見他。

sentences.english: Hollywood turned them into superheroes and supervillains.
sentences.chinese: 好萊塢把他們變成了超級英雄和超級大壞蛋。

sentences.english: That motherfucker hurt my little sister!
sentences.chinese: 那個大壞蛋傷了我的小妹。

sentences.english: How can I trust you to be on time? You're such a bad egg.
sentences.chinese: 我怎麼能相信你會及時到？你真是個大壞蛋。

sentences.english: I think you are a blackguard.
I'm still the baddest 36-year-old ever created.
sentences.chinese: 我仍然是史上最強的36歲大壞蛋。

sentences.english: We all know he is a bad egg.
sentences.chinese: 我們都知道他是個大壞蛋。

sentences.english: Oh, you bad egg, I can see through your intention. You intend to make me die?
sentences.chinese: 大壞蛋，你的伎倆瞞不住我，想要搞死我啊？

definition: lit. rarely seen, very strange (idiom); to express amazement due to lack of experience/naive expression of excitement due to ignorance
worse than a dog or pig/lower than low
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
to steal the show/to grab the limelight
what remains unseen is deemed to be clean/what the eye doesn't see, the heart doesn't grieve over (idiom)
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
